messages.message:
Hi, i’ve logged the first Initiative ticket today on behalf of @Hamish. This is OCR / digitization feedback.

In the example in the ticket, the checkbox renders correctly on our macs, but doesn’t when on AI Hub, which means the extraction then fails. I’ll log other OCR issues under this initiative.

https://instabase.atlassian.net/browse/EPD-1586

Thanks Lee.

I don't know what what's the right ticket type to open; I think field feedback should open as `new feature` ticket, and the PM team will review and move to `initiative`, is that right @hannah? Otherwise we will end up with many duplicated initiatives.

Just for transparency -- in every WBR we review the number of bugs and new feature tickets in the EPD board; we don't review the number of initiative tickets, since the assumption is initiative is something already is on the roadmap (converted from one or multiple bug / new feature tickets).

Thanks Kerry, happy to take any feedback on how these should be logged. Before it was discussed that Intitatives could have muliple of the same examples logged in one ticket. So we’ve have one for all issues with checkboxes, one for all with OCR etc. We could then attach bugs or FRs to this as needed.

I’m keen to capture lots of examples of documents and usecases that we can benchmark performance on to improve feature depth, and also to include in our regression tests. But open to the best way to do this.
I'll align with Product on this

I love the idea of consolidating into a single ticket. I recommend we use this approach, but instead of classifying it as an "initiative" type we still use "New Feature" as it might get missed if we use "initiative" which should be something that will have a fixed release tied to it.
Ok. That works for me. I’ll tag these as something we can collate all these types of requests.
